Centering a kernel matrix

Source: R/normalization.R
centerK.Rd

It is equivalent to compute `K` over centered data (i.e. the mean of each column is subtracted) in Feature Space.

Usage

centerK(K)

Arguments

K

Kernel matrix (class "matrix").

Value

Centered `K` (class "matrix").

Examples

dat <- matrix(rnorm(250),ncol=50,nrow=5)
K <- Linear(dat)
centerK(K)
#>             [,1]       [,2]      [,3]        [,4]       [,5]
#> [1,]  38.8555517 -15.393520 -5.259264   0.4375577 -18.640325
#> [2,] -15.3935202  48.151695 -9.891882 -17.1895187  -5.676774
#> [3,]  -5.2592643  -9.891882 25.865268  -3.3674645  -7.346657
#> [4,]   0.4375577 -17.189519 -3.367465  38.0499034 -17.930478
#> [5,] -18.6403249  -5.676774 -7.346657 -17.9304779  49.594234
